Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery thick-walled vessel, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with a cream-coloured deposit, the exterior is covered with a dark-red slip and remains of nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn and faded, containing an account of wine.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.118)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87623) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87623)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 133 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
